```{r message=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(readxl)
library(haven)
```

Import the `FAS_litters.csv` csv using a relative path.

```{r  message=FALSE}
litters_df = read_csv("data/FAS_litters.csv")

litters_df = janitor::clean_names(litters_df)
```

## Look at data

```{r}
litters_df

head(litters_df)

tail(litters_df)
```

You can use `view`

```{r  eval=FALSE}
view(litters_df)
```

Look at a data summary

```{r}
str(litters_df)

skimr::skim(litters_df)
```

## Options in `read_`*

```{r}
litters_df_0 = read_csv("data/FAS_litters.csv", skip=10,col_names=FALSE)
```

Look at NA values.

```{r}
litters_df_0 = read_csv("data/FAS_litters.csv", na=c("NA",19,"."))
```

Column types

```{r}
litters_df_0 = read_csv("data/FAS_litters.csv", col_types=cols(Group=col_factor()))
```

## Other file types

Import a xlsc file first.

```{r}
mlb_df = read_excel("data/mlb11.xlsx")
```

Import a SAS file.

```{r}
pulse_df = read_sas("data/public_pulse_data.sas7bdat")
```

## Base R

```{r}
litters_df_wrong = read.csv("data/FAS_litters.csv")
```

## Export data

We have code that "cleans" data and need to clean it.

```{r}
litters_df_cleaned = read_csv("data/FAS_litters.csv")

litters_df_cleaned = janitor::clean_names(litters_df_cleaned)

write_csv(litters_df_cleaned, "data/litters.cleaned.csv")
```
